extracted_playbook.title: Implement a Recovery Plan
extracted_playbook.description: Maintain and retain multiple copies of sensitive or proprietary data and servers in a physically separate, segmented, and secure location (i.e., hard drive, storage device, the cloud).

extracted_playbook.title: Enforce NIST Password Standards
extracted_playbook.description: Require all accounts with password logins to comply with NIST’s standards when developing and managing password policies, including using longer passwords, storing passwords in hashed format, adding password user 'salts', avoiding password reuse, implementing account lockouts, disabling password hints, and refraining from frequent password changes.

extracted_playbook.title: Require Administrator Credentials for Software Installation
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure that administrator credentials are required to install software.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Phishing-Resistant Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)
extracted_playbook.description: Use phishing-resistant MFA for remote access and access to any sensitive data repositories. Implement MFA for as many services as possible, particularly for webmail and VPNs.

extracted_playbook.title: Keep Systems Up to Date
extracted_playbook.description: Keep all operating systems, software, and firmware up to date. Prioritize patching known exploited vulnerabilities of internet-facing systems.

extracted_playbook.title: Segment Networks
extracted_playbook.description: Segment networks to prevent the spread of ransomware by controlling traffic flows between subnetworks to restrict adversary lateral movement.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Network Monitoring Tools
extracted_playbook.description: Identify, detect, and investigate abnormal activity and potential traversal of malware with a network monitoring tool. Implement a tool that logs and reports all network traffic, including lateral movement activity.

extracted_playbook.title: Install and Update Antivirus Software
extracted_playbook.description: Install, regularly update, and enable real-time detection for antivirus software on all hosts.

extracted_playbook.title: Review and Audit Accounts
extracted_playbook.description: Review domain controllers, servers, workstations, and active directories for new and/or unrecognized accounts. Audit user accounts with administrative privileges and configure access controls according to the principle of least privilege.

extracted_playbook.title: Disable Unused Ports
extracted_playbook.description: Disable unused ports to reduce attack surfaces.

extracted_playbook.title: Add Email Banners and Disable Hyperlinks
extracted_playbook.description: Consider adding an email banner to emails received from outside your organization and disable hyperlinks in received emails.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Time-Based Access for Admin Accounts
extracted_playbook.description: Implement time-based access for accounts set at the admin level and higher, using methods like Just-in-Time access to enforce the principle of least privilege.

extracted_playbook.title: Disable Command-Line and Scripting Activities
extracted_playbook.description: Disable command-line and scripting activities and permissions to prevent privilege escalation and lateral movement.

extracted_playbook.title: Perform Regular Secure System Backups
extracted_playbook.description: Perform regular secure system backups and create known good copies of all device configurations for repairs and/or restoration. Store copies off-network in physically secure locations and test regularly.

extracted_playbook.title: Ensure Backup Data is Encrypted and Immutable
extracted_playbook.description: Ensure all backup data is encrypted, immutable, and covers the entire organization’s data infrastructure.
